dialog.text: Hi. The seeker  did greeting. The supporter should also do greetings.
Oh, hi. How are you doing?
Yeah, I'm worrying about my friend. The seeker  feels worried about the friend. The supporter should ask more about the friend's situation and try to help the seeker.
I'm so sorry to hear that. Could you tell me more details about that?

Yeah.. We haven't met each other for several years. And we just moved to the same city recently. Last week when we met, I acknowledged that he's now into some drugs. His status was so bad and I really want to help him but I don't how. The seeker  feels worried about the friend. The supporter should ask the seeker how the supporter could help.
I'm so sorry to hear that. It sounds like you are really trying hard to help your friend. Is there anything you can think of that you could do to help your friend?
beam_texts: I'm so sorry to hear that. It sounds like you are really trying hard to help your friend. Is there anything you can think of that you could do to help your friend?

dialog.text: I've tried to talk to him about his addiction and how it's affecting his life but he won't listen. He's also really violent and is not the type to accept help. The seeker  feels worried about her friend. The supporter could suggest the seeker to join a support group or talk to a professional to get more ideas.

I think it would be a good idea for you to get some sort of help, either counselling or something like AA. Addiction is a very difficult thing to deal with and not being able to help your friend will be more damaging than if you had just left him to his own devices.
beam_texts: I think it would be a good idea for you to get some sort of help, either counselling or something like AA. Addiction is a very difficult thing to deal with and not being able to help your friend will be more damaging than if you had just left him to his own devices.

dialog.text: I've tried to get him to go to counseling but he won't listen. I've also tried to get him to go to AA but he won't go. He also won't let me leave his house. The seeker  feels worried and helpless about the friend's addiction. The supporter could suggest the seeker to talk to the friend's family or get some help from the police.
Have you considered getting your own counselling? You could get a few sessions in and see if it makes a difference to you.
beam_texts: Have you considered getting your own counselling? You could get a few sessions in and see if it makes a difference to you.

dialog.text: I've thought about it but I don't have money to pay for it and I can't afford to give him money either. He doesn't have a car. The seeker  feels worried about the friend. The supporter could tell the seeker to get some help to ease the mind.
I think that you should try to talk to him about it and see if it makes a difference to him.
beam_texts: I think that you should try to talk to him about it and see if it makes a difference to him.

dialog.text: I think I will. I just don't want to lose him. The seeker  feels worried about the friend. The supporter could tell the seeker that the friend may not be able to be helped if the friend does not want help.
I think you will be fine, just try to talk to him.
beam_texts: I think you will be fine, just try to talk to him.

dialog.text: I will. I'll try to get him to go to counseling with me too. The seeker  feels worried about their friend's addiction and violence. The supporter suggests the seeker to get help and talk to their friend about it.
I hope he will change. I wish you all the best.
beam_texts: I hope he will change. I wish you all the best.

dialog.text: Thank you. The seeker  feels worried about the friend. The supporter could tell the seeker that it is important to get some help so the seeker will not be damaged.
You're welcome. Have a nice day.
beam_texts: You're welcome. Have a nice day.

dialog.text: You too. The seeker  feels worried about his friend. The supporter could suggest the seeker to get some professional help to deal with the addiction.
Goodbye.
Goodbye. The seeker  feels worried about friend's addiction. The supporter could tell the seeker to try to get help from professional and get some sessions in counselling.
Goodbye.

Goodbye. The seeker  feels worried because the friend just moved to the same city and the friend is into some drugs. The supporter could tell the seeker to try to get help from other people or try to get the friend to go to counseling.
Goodbye.

Goodbye.

Goodbye. The seeker  feels worried about the friend. The seeker is trying to help the friend to get out of drug addiction. The supporter could tell the seeker to try to get more help from other people or try to get the friend to some therapy sessions.
Goodbye.
Goodbye. The seeker  feels worried about her friend. The supporter could tell the seeker that she did everything she could. The supporter could also suggest the seeker to get some professional help.
Goodbye.
Goodbye. The seeker  feels worried about a friend. The supporter could suggest the seeker to get some sessions of counselling and try to talk to the friend again.
Goodbye.

Goodbye.

Goodbye. The seeker  feels worried about his friend who has addiction problem. The seeker is trying to help his friend but does not know how. The supporter could tell the seeker to get some help from professional.
